channel.title: Packing cache help
channel.description:
I need a cache editor that works when I open config.jag with toms nothing happens and I need to replace my loc.dat/.idx can anyone help me pack these??
thanks

item.title: Packing cache help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:7, topic:547138”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666037.msg4452811#msg4452811 date=1412707975]

I just gave you a solution

Now explain how to repack the corrupt parts of the cache.
[/quote]
Okay you find out what files are corrupt. I think openrs does that for you, if not just try load the files and see what happens. Then just replace the files that appear corrupt with ones that aren’t

Heck even check this out http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/downloads/528030-cache-repair-utility-fix-login-blackscreen-more.html[/quote]
That is an interesting tool. I’ve never seen it, may have to try it on a cache or two of mine I have.
I’ll also have to find/check out openrs. Both tools I’ve never seen lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Packing cache help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:547138”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=666037.msg4452810#msg4452810 date=1412707848]
I just gave you a solution
[/quote]
Now explain how to repack the corrupt parts of the cache.[/quote]
Okay you find out what files are corrupt. I think openrs does that for you, if not just try load the files and see what happens. Then just replace the files that appear corrupt with ones that aren’t

Heck even check this out http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs-503-client-server/downloads/528030-cache-repair-utility-fix-login-blackscreen-more.html

Read full topic

item.title: Packing cache help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:3, topic:547138”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666037.msg4452800#msg4452800 date=1412706591]
The reason “nothing happens” is because your cache is corrupt. I’ve never personally found a solution to this issue.
The only workaround I found was to get a 317/377 cache (like the one that came with MITB’s release) and re-add all the content that you have in your corrupt cache into it.
[/quote]
long, it can sometimes just be quicker to fix your corrupted cache.[/quote]
As I said:

sk8rdude461:

[color=red][size=90pt]I’ve never personally found a solution to this issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Packing cache help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The reason “nothing happens” is because your cache is corrupt. I’ve never personally found a solution to this issue.
The only workaround I found was to get a 317/377 cache (like the one that came with MITB’s release) and re-add all the content that you have in your corrupt cache into it.
